Like marble, but It’s not marble
Posted on July 27, 2018
by Chiara Rimella
Atlas Concorde Editor’s Board
You would never say that...
Porcelain floors and walls tiles. Looking like real marble.
Finely crafted interiors in each and every detail encounter a new way of living the city and the search for unique experiences: from dining to wellness, right down to business meetings. International airports, large hotels, exclusive modern buildings, spas and wellness centres are designed with specific and innovative concepts that combine elegance and comfort, meeting the needs of those who want to bring together business, entertainment and relaxation. Atlas Concorde has always dedicated special attention to these hospitality spaces, marked by absolute elegance, by offering surfaces that furnish unmistakably sophisticated and stylish environments where luxury and design coexist.
Discover more on marble trend
There was a little cute house
Porcelain tile. A contemporary material for a classic marble look.

The complete projects for floors and walls interpret the allure of fine and up-to-date marbles with surprising realism and attention to details. Atlas Concorde’s outstanding technical research and production give life to furnishing surfaces that faithfully reproduce the natural material in its graphic depth and the variety of its natural veining.

A wide range of formats and finishes have been conceived for numerous applications and intended uses: halls, receptions, waiting rooms, business lounges, suites, bathrooms and spas. The beauty and splendour of the marbles are revived in a surface that guarantees the excellent technical and functional advantages of porcelain stoneware: perfect technical reproducibility of the same surface over time, resistance to wear, stains and contact with detergents.

An harmonious coating care
How to match the right porcelain tile floor with the right wall tile.

Floor and wall tiles in which the marble- and stone-effect surfaces co-exist and cross-fertilize each other, creating combinations of materials, juxtapositions of colour and encounters between glossy and matt finishes that make the destined spaces unique. Halls, reception areas, waiting rooms, business lounges, suites, fitness rooms and spas are embellished with surfaces that combine the graphic depth of marble and stone to achieve compositions of unmistakeable style, in line with the latest trends in architecture and contemporary design.

Marble-effect surfaces, with porcelain tile flooring and coordinated wall tiles, that are inspired by precious marbles.
What our expert says
Why porcelain tiles are so brilliant!

The veins running through marble can be a rainbow of colours (design hint: marble with pinkish veins works great alongside pink-hued accessories, like copper), and while many think that real marble is the key to finding these colour variations, digitally-printed marble effect porcelain often has more colour variations, because it’s been specially designed in this manner.

These tiles offer the incredible look of real marble and the resilience and hard wearing nature of porcelain. If you’re thinking about redecorating this year, then marble really is a top choice, and it’s right on trend, too.

The glossy, shiny surface is easy to clean, the colour remains unchanged, and is resistant to stains and chemical agents.
The veins running through marble can be a rainbow of colours (design hint: marble with pinkish veins works great alongside pink-hued accessories, like copper), and while many think that real marble is the key to finding these colour variations, digitally-printed marble effect porcelain often has more colour variations, because it’s been specially designed in this manner.
Design trend
Lighting: marble everything
The recent marble revival trend has expanded into the world of lighting. Here are some of our favorite table, floor, and ceiling lamps, most made of marble, others of alabaster and onyx, and all in shapes that are elemental and refined.
